tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking in the previous chapter, Jeremiah 2
AT: "She is completely unclean." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"This land is like that woman!" That is, Yahweh taking the people of Judah back is like a man taking back the wife he earlier divorced. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: You have acted like a whore
tn.text: "You have given your love and trust to idols the way a prostitute gives her body to men not her husband" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: do you want to return to me?
tn.text: AT: "I will not accept you when you try to come back to me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
See how you translated this idea in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
"Look up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Is there is any place where you have not had illicit sex?
tn.text: "You are like a woman who goes everywhere and lets men seize her and sleep with her!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
This refers to bands of robbers in Arabia.
sleeping with many partners
"pay attention" or "listen"
the people of Israel go (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: every high mountain and under every leafy tree
tn.text: The tops of hills and under shade trees were common places for idol worship.
"the people of Judah, who also did not obey me, saw"
Yahweh continues speaking.
"Israel, you have completely stopped obeying me"
disloyal
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
Possible meanings are "who love what I love" or "who want to please me."

The phrase "bear fruit" is an idiomatic way of saying that they will "increase" in number. AT: "will increase greatly in number." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: the house of Judah will walk with the house of Israel
tn.text: "the people of Judah will live together with the people of Israel"
the word "me" refers to Yahweh

tn.ref: honor you as my son ... like a woman
tn.text: This change from male to female is for great emphasis.
See how you translated this idea in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
"People hear a noise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"crying and begging loudly"
The word "Behold" here alerts us to pay attention to the surprising information that follows.

tn.ref: Only lies come from the hills
tn.text: The people expect guidance and gain from idol worship but only find lies. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])

tn.ref: Let us lie down in shame. May our shame cover us
tn.text: These phrases share similar meanings and emphasize that they are fully aware of their shameful behavior. AT: "Let us be completely humiliated." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"the beginning of the nation"
AT: "what Yahweh says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
